website_summaries.verdict: The Horizon KTV is a neutral trail running shoe that has become Under Armour’s re-entry into the trail running category. Coming in with vibrant color variations, the Under Armour Horizon KTV was designed to allow runners to run faster and safer on various terrains. With the shoe’s reliable traction, secure lacing system, and durable upper, it seems that Under Armour’s entrance into the scene of trail running has become a smooth one.
pros: Most users mentioned that the shoe felt sturdy and supportive
‘Lightweight’ was an adjective that was frequently found in several reviews
A lot of users appreciated the vibrant colors of the shoe, as well as its design
One reviewer mentioned that the shoe protected her feet from getting wet
The grip of the shoe was very impressive, said a majority of reviewers
Some testers appreciated that the shoe could be cleaned with minimal effort
The lacing system was another highlight found in most reviews
Testers said that the tightness of the lacing stayed the same all throughout their runs
cons: Most reviewers observed that the shoe felt too tight or too small for their feet
A few testers mentioned that the shoe heated up easily
They concluded that it was because of the film on the upper of the Under Armour Horizon KTV
The film layer in the upper also made the shoe stiff, according to a number of reviews
One tester observed that the color of the shoe’s interior wore off on his white socks after use

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking shoe, but not comfortable for actual athletic use.
customer_reviews.text: A couple issues with these shoes: 1) Red dye came off on my socks under normal (sweaty) use. 2) rubber coating really inhibits breathing such that these shoes are much hotter than typical trainers 3) Rear heal isn't notched, so it rubs on my Achilles tendon. Not too bad, but wouldn't buy again for this reason alone. Otherwise I like how they look, but not enough to continue wearing!
customer_reviews.author: S. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product. Have used it like for a month ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. Have used it like for a month now and no issues at all. Feels comfortable while walking and running. The sole has a Michelin marked explicitly so I hope it has got the grip approved my Michelin. My family and friends liked it and they already mentioned to this one. This shoe does captures the attention.
customer_reviews.author: Vw

customer_reviews.title: Hard as a rock, loud.
customer_reviews.text: Seem to fit somewhat loose and actually they are really hard and not very comfy at all. Ive had them for a few months and switched to a different UA shoe without the giant plastic pieces. Also, the plastic makes a crumpling sound/pop on every step.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler J. Dietzenbach

customer_reviews.title: I love the shoe I use them for training at gym
customer_reviews.text: I love the shoe I use them for training at gym , good looking shoe light the bottom grap of shoe helps I would buy over and over ,
customer_reviews.author: Mike Amezcua

customer_reviews.title: Pretty easy to clean off too
customer_reviews.text: I run a lot of trails and these are built to really tear into the dirt and mud. Pretty easy to clean off too!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Smythe

customer_reviews.title: High price?
customer_reviews.text: I will say this very good brand , perfect shap
customer_reviews.author: Maytham

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: One of The tighter fitting shoes I've had, but if they are very sturdy and supportive.
customer_reviews.author: todd f. fisher

customer_reviews.title: Fit just like the rest of my under armour running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Fit just like the rest of my under armour running shoes. Virtually no break in period, I’m usinging then on rocky rough terrain and they are holding up great so far! Got about two weeks of wear and feeling great!
customer_reviews.author: Antonio S Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: REAL OBSERVATION
customer_reviews.text: The fit is perfect to size I'm 5'9" 190lbs. Size 11.5 what I hate about this shoe it's very hard to break it in. I tried them on and ran 5miles and they felt like BRICKS on my feet. They are good for when im just lifting weights not running.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin

customer_reviews.title: Order 1/2 size up...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe just a tad small but still fits. Order 1/2 size up.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend them to run on the mountain after walking 3 km they become uncomfortable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Floor Installers
customer_reviews.text: I lay floors, the toe rubber is thick and well adhered. They do fit about a half size small I wear a 13 and they're tight
customer_reviews.author: cmoore32789

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pinch a little bit where the elastic meets the inside sole but other wise a comfy shoe
customer_reviews.author: Upset

customer_reviews.title: Sole falling off
customer_reviews.text: Sole started falling off after only 30 miles of running
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Light weight weight which I like but too narrow and tight.
customer_reviews.author: Steve  Johnson

customer_reviews.title: May want to add odor power.
customer_reviews.text: Snug fit bu there's something about the material which creates coupled with moist feet causes an odor; however they're easy to wash.
customer_reviews.author: APEX III

customer_reviews.title: Painfully rigid
customer_reviews.text: Ouch! These shoes look fantastic but they destroy my feet, beware. Because the uppers are made of a rigid, inflexible material they clean up nice and are light, but as in the case of a previous reviewer the uppers dig into your foot when you flex the shoe bruising and creating blisters. If you cut from side to side the uppers don't give and the top of my foot has bruising, which is pretty painful. I thought that I could get away with wearing these around the house but I can't even do that because it hurts too much. I highly don't recommend these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Under Armour Men's Ua Horizon Ktv 1287335-100 Trainers
product_meta.description: Modern, universal shoes with zip. Rich-Skins provide a luxurious, elegant look with delicate butter. Breathable and hygienic room climate is provided by a pleasant fibre system.
feature_bullets: Internal bootie construction for superior fit
Molded collar foam package for added comfort
Charged Cushioning foam puck placed under the heel for responsive comfort
Lightweight, full-length EVA midsole for optimal cushioning
